text: in this video I'm going to teach you how
to make these travel themed candles
what you're gonna need is scotch tape a
pencil ruler I'm using a thick piece of
paper because I can't find my ruler a
glue stick ribbon candle holders that
look like so which I got from Dollar
Amma and a printout of a map of your
choice first you're going to take your
ruler or paper like I'm using to measure
the height of the candle next take your
map and using your height measurements
from the candle make three marks like so
on the map next draw a line along
connecting your three marks then cut
along the line so you have a strip of
the image you chose that is longer than
the circumference of the candle and the
exact height as you measured take the
strip and making sure that it is lined
up tape one edge onto the candle holder
wrap the strip around until it reaches
the tape edge and leaving it overlapping
just enough to hide the tape plus a
centimeter more glue the connecting edge
onto the tape down edge like so cut any
excess of the strip next take your
ribbon and before cutting in wrap it
around the circumference of the candle
so you have the exact cut required once
you do tape down one edge like so at the
bottom of the candle holder and get your
glue stick and put glue all along the
bottom of the candle holder take the
ribbon and stick it along the bottom of
the candle holder until it meets up with
the tape down edge do the same to the
top of the candle holder only this time
you're going to fold the ribbon in two
before attaching it and voila
if you prefer the look of the candle
without the trim along the top in the
bottom feel free to leave it off or you
can change it up a bit maybe you can add
some beads or some sequins I would love
to see how your candles turn out be
to send me a picture on Facebook or
Twitter or through email at Kristen J at
hopscotch the globe comm you can find
all the links in the description box
below until next time adventurers happy
travels
